00016 <html>
00017     <head>
00018         <style >
00019             @import url("css/default.css");
00020         </style>
00021         <title>
00022             Code To Diagram - Automatic Sequence Diagram
00023         </title>
00024     </head>
00025     <body>
00026     <h3>
00027         Code To Diagram
00028     </h3>
00029     <h4> Sequence Diagram Generator Of Code Execution - PHP => HTML  </h4>
00030         <div class="intro">
00031             <p>
00032                 The sequence diagram it is probably the must intuitive way to understand some code execution.
00033             </p>
00034             <p>
00035                 Use it in the pre-project phase it is very common to describe the excepted behavior
00036                 from some software. From the sequence diagram it is possible to developer test diagram,
00037                 as check if all the features used on it was describe into the another phase of the planning
00038                 as the use cases, for example.
00039             </p>
00040             <p>
00041                 When the sequence diagram it is used to describe the features into the code level, as the
00042                 interaction of objects, using methods, it is possible to plan how the classes will be. But,
00043                 as the code development evolves, been caused by the analysis fail or by requirement change,
00044                 the diagrams will losing the link with the reality losing consequently the descriptive function
00045                 to one analysis history function.
00046             </p>
00047             <p>
00048                 Also, to require the existence of one diagram to each test methods of some project will bring
00049                 a huge spent of time, into it's creation as is in the maintenance. This is because each change
00050                 of some method name or attribute name will require a change into all diagrams what involve it.
00051             </p>
00052             <p>
00053                 The solution proposed here it is the automatic generation of sequence diagrams based on the PHP
00054                 code execution. One full code execution or some stretch of execution it is monitored by classes
00055                 of code instrumentation what, based on the in formations received, creating the diagram of that
00056                 code execution. This diagram can be seen as HTML, saved as HTML, and also to be saved
00057                 as XML and in the future exported as a jpeg image.
00058             </p>
00059             <p>
00060                 All this process must be simple and enough to be used simply append one call, but flexible also
00061                 to deal with all the special cases. The big idea it is to create the diagram of the execution been
00062                 less invader as possible into the source code what the execution will run. You can see the runing
00063                 examples <a href="..\examples">here</a>.
00064             </p>
00065             <p>
00066                 One small component was created in the process of generation of this software what can be used separately.
00067                 It is the generator of sequence diagrams from one XML.
00068                 This application can be test
00069                 <a href="xmlToDiagram.php"> here </a>
00070                 where one XML of example it is used but can be change freely.
00071             </p>
00072             <p>
00073                 The target of this project it is make possible the generation of a sequence diagram from each test method.
00074                 Been each generated diagram saved with an easy to find name. Some new features should be appending to as
00075                 show the code of the caller, make improvements into the parameters descriptions and many more.
00076             </p>
00077             <p>
00078                 You can download the last version of this project just downloading from it's 
00079                 <a href="http://subversion.assembla.com/svn/codetodiagram" title="Code to Diagram - SVN">
00080                     SVN.
00081                 </a>
00082                 
00083                 But, if you just want to take a look into the code, it is better view by
00084                 <a href="http://code.assembla.com/codetodiagram/subversion/nodes" title="Code to Diagram - SVN Nodes" >
00085                     this
00086                 </a>
00087                 link.
00088             </p>
00089             <p>
00090                 While still not fully working on Internet Explorer, the generator already makes life easier for those responsible
00091                 in maintaining this kind of diagrams. We welcome anyone with the patience and desire to make the CSS changes need
00092                 for it to work on IE.
00093             </p>
00094             <p>
00095                 Also, fully compliance with UML 2.0 is still under development. Anyone interested in working in these fields is more
00096                 than welcome to join the team. And if you have a patch on add-on to send, feel free to do so.And remember, this is
00097                 free software, and as such, I can give you no warranty. Use it at your own risk. It's not for the faint of heart.
00098             </p>
00099             <p>
00100                 Click
